translations.text: When the sky is rent asunder
and hearkens to the command<sup foot_note="182640">1</sup> of its Lord, doing what it should;
and when the earth is stretched out<sup foot_note="182641">1</sup>
and casts out what is within it and is emptied,<sup foot_note="182642">1</sup>
and hearkens to the command of its Lord, doing what it should.<sup foot_note="182643">1</sup>
O man, you are striving unto your Lord<sup foot_note="182644">1</sup> and you will meet Him.
Whoever is given the Record in his right hand
shall be called to an easy accounting,<sup foot_note="182645">1</sup>
and shall return to his people joyfully.<sup foot_note="182646">1</sup>
But he who is given the Record behind his back,<sup foot_note="182647">1</sup>
shall cry for “perdition,”
and will enter the Blazing Fire.
He used to live joyfully among his people,<sup foot_note="182648">1</sup>
thinking he would never revert (to Us).
But no; (how would he not revert)? His Lord was ever watching him.<sup foot_note="182649">1</sup>
Nay; I swear by the twilight;
and by the night and what it enfolds,
and by the moon, when it reaches its fullness:
you shall proceed onwards from stage to stage.<sup foot_note="182650">1</sup>
So, what is the matter with them that they do not believe,
and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate<sup foot_note="182651">1</sup> themselves?
Instead, the unbelievers reject it, calling it a lie.
Allah knows best what they are accumulating (in their Record).<sup foot_note="182652">1</sup>
So give them the good news of a painful chastisement,
except for those who believe and do good deeds. Theirs shall be an unending reward.
